content:
As an AI language model, I do not have access to specific cruise line policies, but generally speaking, it is typically not allowed to bring your own food on board a cruise ship. Cruise lines typically have strict policies prohibiting passengers from bringing any type of food or drink on board with the exception of small amounts of pre-packaged food, like snack bars or fruits.

However, most cruise lines offer a variety of complimentary and less expensive dining options, even some restaurants with no additional charge. This can range from casual buffet-style dining to traditional dining rooms that offer fine dining meals at no extra charge. Generally, passengers can opt for these options without needing to spend extra on the more expensive restaurants.

It's essential to check with your specific cruise line for their policies regarding outside food or dining options before boarding. And, as I mentioned before, you can save money by bringing your beverages or drinks onboard, as drinks can be quite costly on a cruise. 

So, it's always wise to research and take advantage of the dining options available on your cruise to save money, rather than trying to bring your own food on board.
